page.title: 18Games Children Play
page.content: The Grand Old Duke Of York The Grand old Duke Of York is a game where there has to be six pairs or more. The couples stand opposite each other in two lines and everyone sings "The Grand Old Duke Of York" The couple on one end skip up the middle and back again. They separate and each skips behind their own line. The line follows behind them. At the other end they make an arch and everyone passes through with their partner. Forty-Forty. You need more than two players for this game. One person is chosen to count to forty. While he is counting everyone hides. The counter then searches for the others. When he sees one he runs back to his post and shouts "Forty-Forty" and their name. The first person seen becomes the new catcher.
